channel.title: Computer Question
channel.description:
Well, I got a new computer and I'm having a little problem.....
There is this awful annoying damn CAPS lock message/image appearing on the center of the screen when I turn it off/on, I was wondering how I would turn this off?
Of course I'm using Google to figure it out as well but if someone has some instant tips on how to disable it, I'll appreciate it! http://computers.pricegrabber.com/laptop/m/913476930/

item.title: Computer Question
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Yeah but that isn’t all.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Question
item.dc:creator: @classic mopmans little slave
item.description:
@classic wrote:

[quote=“tL, post:18, topic:426765”][quote author=Classic_ link=topic=529464.msg3865210#msg3865210 date=1324948723]
James, All Have crapware on it, they give it too you such as bad webcam software, and stuff made by them, I usually take all that crap off my computer or re-install a fresh copy of windows on m or any other operating system i prefer.
[/quote]

Not all… -___-[/quote]
Most bought computers

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Question
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

HcoJustin:

Err… Why? Just remove the bloatware, and save yourself the trouble of doing something completely unneeded

I’m not quite familiar on how this little message works along with the rest, I’m not the best at computers but I know enough to get me around and help others with what knowledge I have. And because from what I heard (not sure if true), Windows XP would be better because it would be running 15 processes (if I know what I’m doing) and thus leading to not a bunch of problems.

Davidi2:

I had big green text saying the same thing when I installed a new keyboard with its software on my computer. Had nothing to do with the operating system in my case.

I’ll look into the file location of this process creating this message, it seems so far when I don’t have it on, it doesn’t create other problems, however, the problem is I don’t have a little LED light beside the CAPS LOCK or NUMS LOCK so I can’t tell if it’s CAPS or NUMS etc., that’s the downside.

Read full topic

[quote=“tL, post:11, topic:426765”]I think that’s was more of a suggestion.

I figured it out as well, stupid process had to do with something along the lines of “helping the computer navigation easier”.

tL:
